name: Apollo
god: God of oracles, healing, archery, music and arts, sunlight, knowledge, herds and flocks, and protection of the young
symbol: Lyre, laurel wreath, Python (mythology)|python, bow and arrows
sibling: Artemis (twin), Aeacus, Angelos (Greek mythology)|Angelos, Aphrodite, Ares, Athena, Dionysus, Eileithyia, Enyo, Eris (mythology)|Eris, Ersa, Hebe (mythology)|Hebe, Helen of Troy, Hephaestus, Heracles, Hermes, Minos, Pandia, Persephone, Perseus, Rhadamanthus, the Graces, the Horae, the Litae, the Muses, the Moirai
children: Asclepius, Aristaeus, Corybantes, Hymen (god)|Hymenaeus, Apollonis, Amphiaraus, Anius, Apis (Greek mythology)|Apis, Cycnus of Aetolia|Cycnus, Eurydice, Hector, Linus of Thrace, Lycomedes, Melaneus, Melite (heroine)|Melite, Miletus (mythology)|Miletus, Mopsus (son of Manto)|Mopsus, Oaxes, Oncius, Orpheus, Troilus, Phemonoe, Philammon, Tenerus (son of Apollo)|Tenerus, Trophonius, and Apollo#Children|various others
